content.description: Climb start of Death Penalty to first bolt. Traverse left towards arete and up to the summit clipping bolts.
content.location: Next route left of Death Penalty. Climbs the arete.

content.description:
Start by making a few good jams off the start then keep working up the weakness placing small micro gear. Climb weakness until you reach a large crystal and traverse right on big holds past a bolt and into the steep left facing flake. 

 Gear is a bit tricky down low and rock quality could be better. Overall good route and fun moves that keep you on your toes. Gear is all there but you have to work for it. Bring a few larger cams up higher to make it easier to place.Â
content.protection: Green C3-#.5, RPs   1 Bolt   Bolted Webbing Anchor
content.location: On the Far North side of the East face. Follows the arete.

climbs.name: Death Penalty
climbs.fa: Cindy Tolle, Pete Delannoy, and Nancy Robillar, Aug. 10, 1989.

content.description:
A well protected route with fun movements.  

  Access the line of bolts by jamming and placing in the somewhat dirty crack. Traverse left onto the first bolt and follow the line as it trends up and left following the bolt line.
content.location: Located on the east face of the isolated spires. Bolted line to the left of the wide crack.

content.description: This area holds lots old climbs on it. Including Limited Immunity, 5.11+ Pete Delannoy route. Holds both shade and sun as well as sport, mixed, and pure trad lines.
